title: 111_s363
content: The Trade CLAIM Act is the short title for the Trade Complaint and Litigation Accountability Improvement Measures Act. It allows for the review of determinations made by the United States Trade Representative by the Court of International Trade. Section 1581 of title 28, United States Code is amended to give the Court of International Trade exclusive jurisdiction over civil actions requesting the United States Trade Representative to review determinations under the Trade Act of 1974. The Court of International Trade has exclusive jurisdiction over civil actions related to the Trade Act of 1974, including sections 305(a)(2)(A)(ii), 306(b), and 307(a)(1) of the Act. SEC. 3.
